alert.note: Alert for Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 7:12PM EDT until May 06 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio, South Central Ohio, Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In South Central Ohio, Ross. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton. In West Central Ohio, Greene. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM EDT, the public reported minor flooding in various locations across the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Blanchester, Sabina, New Holland, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Clarksburg, Midland, Bowersville, Port William, Milledgeville, Octa, Reesville, Lees Creek and Melvin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
